children.name: Producer's Note on Thimble
children.body: Our Thimble character. Inside of the game engine, it is composed of a few different components, from the bone-rigged body to the blendshape-based face.
children.creator: PRODUCER

children.name: Producer's Note on Thimble Walk Cycle and Thimble

children.name: Cookie Tin in Scene

children.creator: PRODUCER

children.name: scene.v001.ma
children.description: Single marble asset - materials assignments are done in-engine to get multiple variations.
children.creator: PRODUCER

children.name: Marble Surfacing
children.body: Like many assets, the marble isn't textured by any software and is instead surfaced with in-engine materials.
children.creator: PRODUCER

children.name: scene.v003.ma
children.description: Fixed pivot for multi-engine integration and nomenclature
children.creator: PRODUCER

children.description: The ambient HDRI for the world of the sequence. This HDRI has been edited in Photoshop multiple times to adjust the final in-engine look.
children.name: Ambient HDRI
Producer's Note on Shot001
children.body: This is the only sequence in the project. In most game engine TV or Film projects animation is handled per-sequence; with one or more shots being continuously assembled in the main sequence timeline.
children.creator: PRODUCER

children.description: We close into a shot of the falling thimble
children.name: SH002

children.description: The thimble freaks out over it's change at life
children.name: SH004

children.description: It looks over to the other side of the table. What's going on?
children.name: SH005

children.name: Producer's Note on Animatic and S001
children.creator: PRODUCER

children.name: About Sequences in Real-Time Rendering
children.body: This is the only sequence in the project. In most game engine TV or Film projects, animation is handled per-sequence; with one or more shots being assembled in the main sequence timeline. This is usually one scene of the video on one set.
children.creator: PRODUCER
